xxl.core.relational.cursors
Class SortBasedGrouper

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.cursors.AbstractCursor<Cursor<E>>
      xxl.core.cursors.groupers.SortBasedGrouper<Tuple>
          xxl.core.relational.cursors.SortBasedGrouper
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.Iterator<Cursor<Tuple>>, Cursor<Cursor<Tuple>>, MetaDataCursor<Cursor<Tuple>,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>, MetaDataProvider<CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>
public class SortBasedGrouper
extends SortBasedGrouper<Tuple>
implements MetaDataCursor<Cursor<Tuple>,CompositeMetaData<java.lang.Object,java.lang.Object>>

The sort-based grouper is an implementation of the group operator. It is based on SortBasedGrouper. The input relation has to be sorted so that all elements belonging to the same group have to be in sequence. Then, a group is defined by a predicate that returns false at the end of such a sequence.

A call to the next method returns a group (cursor) containing all elements of a group.

Usually, a group-aggregator is applied on the output of a grouper.

Parameters:
sortedCursor - the sorted metadata cursor containing elements.
columns - if the values in the passed column numbers differ, a new group is created. The first column is 1, the second is 2, ...

SortBasedGrouper

public SortBasedGrouper(java.sql.ResultSet sortedResultSet,
                        Function<? super java.sql.ResultSet,? extends Tuple> createTuple,
                        Predicate<? super Tuple> predicate)
Constructs an instance of the sort-based grouper.

Parameters:
sortedResultSet - the sorted result set containing elements.
createTuple - a function that maps a (row of the) result set to a tuple. The function gets a result set and maps the current row to a tuple. If null is passed, the factory method of array-tuple is used. It is forbidden to call the next, update and similar methods of the result set from inside the function!
predicate - the predicate that determines the borders of the groups.
